ygData.subject: Re: Re: [EQ] Mysteries of Norrath
ygData.msgSnippet: No one looted the sword. I was in the beta, and it was unlootable, everyone could go to the body and loot at the weapon, but no one could get the weapon. if
ygData.messageBody:
No one looted the sword. I was in the beta, and it was unlootable, everyone
could go to the body and loot at the weapon, but no one could get the
weapon.

if you look at the EQVault archives, you will see that it was stated that
the sword WAS in game, but as a result that no one in any of the servers had
the sword they [Verant] decided that the quest must have been too hard so
they are going to redesign the quest to make the sword more accessable.

guess your facts just needed a little refining :)


-----Original Message-----
From: srutkowski@... <srutkowski@...>
To: EQ-Quest@onelist.com <EQ-Quest@onelist.com>
Date: Thursday, December 30, 1999 11:45 AM
Subject: [EQ-Quest] Re: [EQ] Mysteries of Norrath


>From: srutkowski@...
>
>
>
>One piece about the below is false. On the final day in beta, the Gods
>themselves waged war, and I believe that everyone was turned to PvP. This
event
>did not happen at the arena. Aradune was slain protecting Karana. And I
>believe it was in Nek Forest, but I could have the location wrong.
>
>
>2. THE FIERY AVENGER
>
>FACT: Aradune once wielded a weapon called the Fiery Avenger that looked
like a
>Flaming Sword. The Sword had been looted off of Aradune by a player in the
Arena
>after a PvP event in the final phases of beta. This the ONLY confirmed time
>anyone but Aradune EVER wielded a Fiery Avenger. The Fiery Avenger is a two
>handed slash weapon with very good damage and delay, and a Direct Damage
effect.
>REMEMBER ALL OF THE ABOVE IS PROVEN TO BE TRUE.
>
>>
